item.title: Projectiles not locking on
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

well this is my first spell

if(c.spellID == 1152) { //Wind strike
	if(!c.playerHasItemAmount(556, 1) || !c.playerHasItemAmount(558, 1)) {
		c.sendMessage("You do not have the correct runes to cast this spell.");
	} else if(c.playerHasItemAmount(556, 1) && c.playerHasItemAmount(558, 1)) {
		c.deleteItem(556, c.getItemSlot(556), 1);
		c.deleteItem(558, c.getItemSlot(558), 1);
		c.setAnimation(711);
		c.frame174(993, 0, 15);
		castOnPlayer.frame174(993, 0, 15);
		//c.areaSound(993, 0, 15);
		c.gfx100(90);
		c.ProjectileSpec(91, c.absY, c.absX, offsetY, offsetX, index, EnemyY, EnemyX);
		magicMaxHit = 2;
		c.cantWalkTimer = 5;
		magicDamageTimer = 3;
		if(c.HitMage(index)) {
			attackingMage = true;
			mageGFX = 92;
		} else if(!c.HitMage(index)) {
			attackingMage = true;
			mageSplash = true;
			mageGFX = 85;
		}
	}
}

it works almost 100% (the delay between casting and damage doesn’t work yet) but the projectile doesn’t go in the correct direction…

as you can see i have the projectile locking on to “index” which is the player that i am casting on, but the gfx just flies randomly… therefore im assuming the problem is in the method i posted above? (projectilespec uses that method as it’s base)

Read full topic

item.title: Projectiles not locking on
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

because you have it locking on to an npc index…so it flies to the nearest (or randomly selected) npc index, create a player index.
ps love the gameframe

Read full topic

item.title: Projectiles not locking on
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

well, when i create a moving projectile, it does everything exactly how it is supposed to, however, when I make the projectile move toward a player, it just flies in a random direction. The only thing is, when i use the same method on an npc, it locks on perfectly.

I’ve been trying to fix this but I can’t seem to get it.

This is the method I am using

boolean specspell(int castID, int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int startHeight, int endHeight, int enemyY,int enemyX, int Lockon) 
{
try {
fcastid = castID;
fcasterY = casterY;
fcasterX = casterX;
foffsetY = offsetY;
foffsetX = offsetX;
fangle = angle;
fspeed = speed;
fsh = startHeight;
feh = endHeight;
fenemyY = enemyY;
fenemyX = enemyX;
fLockon = Lockon;

actionTimer = 0;

    if(cast == false) {
createProjectile(casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, angle, speed, castID, startHeight, endHeight, Lockon);
        cast = true;
        firingspell = true;
        }
    if(cast == true && fired == false) {
	firingspell = false;
	cast = false;
	fired = false;
        }
} catch(Exception E) {
}
        return true;
    }

here are two examples:

LOCKON

DOES NOT LOCKON

Read full topic
